subject: Public Speaking
title: Gorbachev at the UN in 1988
description: A 60-second lesson on Gorbachev at the UN in 1988.

hook.text: In 1988, a Soviet leader stood before the UN and renounced the use of force in international relations.

buildup.text: Gorbachev announced unilateral troop reductions and told the world that ideology should not dictate foreign policy.

discovery.text: Western leaders were stunned. A Soviet premier was voluntarily dismantling the Cold War framework.

twist.text: Within three years, the Soviet Union itself would collapse. Gorbachev's speech accelerated his own system's end.

climax.text: He proved that a speech can end an era â€” even when the speaker doesn't fully control what comes next.

punchline.text: He talked his empire into history.

quiz.question: What did Gorbachev announce in his 1988 UN speech?
options: Renunciation of force and unilateral troop reductions
